COLUMNS_DESCRIPTION.ref: Nucleotide sequence in the reference genome (restricted to 50bp)
COLUMNS_DESCRIPTION.totalReadDepth: Total number of reads covering the position
COLUMNS_DESCRIPTION.varReadDepth: Number of reads supporting the variant
COLUMNS_DESCRIPTION.readsVariationPercent: Percent of reads supporting variant over those supporting reference sequence/base
COLUMNS_DESCRIPTION.QUALphred: QUAL: The Phred scaled probability that a REF/ALT polymorphism exists at this site given sequencing data. Because the Phred scale is -10*log(1-p), a value of 10 indicates a 1 in 10 chance of error, while a 100 indicates a 1 in 10^10 chance. These values can grow very large when a large amount of NGS data is used for variant calling.
COLUMNS_DESCRIPTION.varType: Variant Type (substitution, deletion, insertion, duplication, delins)
COLUMNS_DESCRIPTION.codingEffect: Variant Coding effect (synonymous, missense, stop gain, in-frame, frameshift, start loss, stop loss)
COLUMNS_DESCRIPTION.exon: Exon number (nearest exon if intronic variant)
COLUMNS_DESCRIPTION.clinVarIds: List of ClinVar Ids separated by '|'
COLUMNS_DESCRIPTION.clinVarOrigins: List of ClinVar origins separated by '|', values: germline, somatic, de novo, maternal...
COLUMNS_DESCRIPTION.clinVarMethods: List of ClinVar methods separated by '|', values: clinical testing, research, literature only...
COLUMNS_DESCRIPTION.clinVarClinSignifs: List of ClinVar clinical significances separated by '|'
COLUMNS_DESCRIPTION.clinVarReviewStatus: List of ClinVar reviews separated by '|', number of stars (0-4)
COLUMNS_DESCRIPTION.clinVarPhenotypes: List of ClinVar phenotypes Ids separated by '|'
COLUMNS_DESCRIPTION.1000g_AFR_AF: 1000 genomes allele frequency in African population
COLUMNS_DESCRIPTION.1000g_SAS_AF: 1000 genomes allele frequency in South Asian population
COLUMNS_DESCRIPTION.1000g_EAS_AF: 1000 genomes allele frequency in East Asian population
COLUMNS_DESCRIPTION.1000g_EUR_AF: 1000 genomes allele frequency in European population
COLUMNS_DESCRIPTION.1000g_AMR_AF: 1000 genomes allele frequency in American population
COLUMNS_DESCRIPTION.gnomadAltFreq_popmax: gnomAD alternate allele frequency (Maximum Allele Frequency across populations, excluding OTH)
COLUMNS_DESCRIPTION.gnomadHomCount_popmax: gnomAD homozygous genotype count (Maximum Allele Frequency across populations, excluding OTH)
COLUMNS_DESCRIPTION.gnomadHetCount_popmax: gnomAD heterozygous genotype count (Maximum Allele Frequency across populations, excluding OTH)
COLUMNS_DESCRIPTION.gnomadHemCount_popmax: gnomAD hemizygous genotype count (Maximum Allele Frequency across populations, excluding OTH)
COLUMNS_DESCRIPTION.gnomadFilter: gnomAD VCF filter value (AC0, PASS, RF...)
COLUMNS_DESCRIPTION.gnomadOrigin: gnomAD variant origin (Exomes, genomes, or both)
COLUMNS_DESCRIPTION.deltaMaxEntSscorePercent: % difference between the splice score of variant with the score of the reference base
COLUMNS_DESCRIPTION.deltaSSFscorePercent: % difference between the splice score of variant with the score of the reference base
COLUMNS_DESCRIPTION.deltaNNSscorePercent: % difference between the splice score of variant with the score of the reference base
COLUMNS_DESCRIPTION.localSpliceEffect: Splicing  effect  in  variation  vicinity  (New  donor  Site,  New  Acceptor  Site,  Cryptic  Donor  Strongly  Activated, Cryptic Donor Weakly Activated, Cryptic Acceptor Strongly Activated, Cryptic Acceptor Weakly Activated)
COLUMNS_DESCRIPTION.localSpliceSiteAnnotation: Splice site annotation: 'essential splice donor': variant in 5' SS at intronic position +1 or +2, 'essential splice acceptor': variant in 3' SS at intronic position -1 or -2, 'close splice donor': variant in 5' SS at position -3 to -1, +3 to +6, 'close splice acceptor': variant in 3' SS at position -12 to -2, and 0 to +2
COLUMNS_DESCRIPTION.localSS_pos: Genomic position of predicted new splice site or activated cryptic site
COLUMNS_DESCRIPTION.localSS_wtMaxEntScore: WT seq. MaxEntScan score used for local splice effect detection
COLUMNS_DESCRIPTION.localSS_wtNNSScore: WT seq. NNSPLICE score used for local splice effect detection
COLUMNS_DESCRIPTION.localSS_wtHSFScore: WT seq. HSF score used for local splice effect detection
COLUMNS_DESCRIPTION.localSS_varMaxEntScore: Variant seq. MaxEntScan score used for local splice effect detection
COLUMNS_DESCRIPTION.localSS_varNNSScore: Variant seq. NNSPLICE score used for local splice effect detection
COLUMNS_DESCRIPTION.localSS_varHSFScore: Variant seq. HSF score used for local splice effect detection
COLUMNS_DESCRIPTION.branchPointPos: Genomic position of affected putative branch point
COLUMNS_DESCRIPTION.branchPointChange: Change between WT and variant BP scores (range -5 to 100)
COLUMNS_DESCRIPTION.SIFTweight: SIFT score ranges from 0 to 1. The amino acid substitution is predicted damaging is the score is <= 0.05, and tolerated if the score is > 0.05
COLUMNS_DESCRIPTION.SIFTmedian: SIFT median ranges from 0 to 4.32. This is used to measure the diversity of the sequences used for prediction. A warning will occur if this is greater than 3.25 because this indicates that the prediction was based on closely related sequences. The number should be between 2.75 and 3.5
COLUMNS_DESCRIPTION.PPH2pred: PolyPhen-2 prediction using HumVar model are either 'neutral, possibly damaging, probably damaging' or 'neutral, deleterious' depending on the annotation engine.
COLUMNS_DESCRIPTION.annotationAnalysis: Indicates the annotation status (value: Yes or No)
COLUMNS_DESCRIPTION.avgTotalDepth: Total read depth average at the variant position for all samples analyzed that have the variation
COLUMNS_DESCRIPTION.countTotalDepth: Number of samples considered for the average total read depth
COLUMNS_DESCRIPTION.avgVariantDepth: Variation read depth average at the variant position for all samples analyzed that have the variation
COLUMNS_DESCRIPTION.countVariantDepth: Number of samples considered for the average SNV read depth
COLUMNS_DESCRIPTION.familyBarcode: Homozygote or heterozygote status for the sample of interest and its associated samples
COLUMNS_DESCRIPTION.barcode: Homozygote or heterozygote status for all sample analyzed together (Hom: 2 ; Het: 1; Sample name is given at the first line of the file: ## Barcode)
COLUMNS_DESCRIPTION.homCount: Number of homozygote over all samples analyzed together
COLUMNS_DESCRIPTION.hetCount: Number of heterozygote over all samples analyzed together
COLUMNS_DESCRIPTION.alleleCount: Number of alleles supporting the variant
COLUMNS_DESCRIPTION.alleleFrequency: Allele frequency in all samples analyzed (with 4 decimals)
COLUMNS_DESCRIPTION.samVa: Sample ID of the 10 first non WT variants, with their homozygote/heterozygote status
COLUMNS_DESCRIPTION.Annotation_Impact: Estimation of putative impact / deleteriousness : {HIGH, MODERATE, LOW, MODIFIER}
COLUMNS_DESCRIPTION.Feature_Type: Which type of feature is in the next field (e.g. transcript, motif, miRNA, ...)
COLUMNS_DESCRIPTION.Feature_ID: Transcript ID (preferably using version number), Motif ID, miRNA, ...)
COLUMNS_DESCRIPTION.Transcript_BioType: The bare minimum is at least a description on whether the transcript is {'Coding', 'Noncoding'}
COLUMNS_DESCRIPTION.Distance: Up/Downstream: Distance to first / last codon Intergenic: Distance to closest gene Distance to closest Intron boundary in exon (+/- up/downstream)
COLUMNS_DESCRIPTION.dbNSFP_MetaSVM_pred: dbNSFP scores based on 10 component scores (SIFT, PolyPhen-2 HDIV and HVAR, GERP++, MutationTaster, Mutation Assessor, FATHMM, LRT, SiPhy, PhyloP) and the maximum frequency observed (1000 genomes)
COLUMNS_DESCRIPTION.Inheritance: e.g. AD (= 'Autosomal dominant'). Detailed in VaRank 1.4.3 FAQ.
COLUMNS_DESCRIPTION.synZ: Positive synZ (Z score) indicate gene intolerance to synonymous variation
COLUMNS_DESCRIPTION.misZ: Positive misZ (Z score) indicate gene intolerance to missense variation
COLUMNS_DESCRIPTION.pLI: Score computed in the ExAc database indicating the probability that a gene is intolerant to a loss of function variation  (Nonsense,  splice  acceptor  and  donor  variants  caused  by  SNV).  ExAC  consider  pLI  >=  0.9  as  an extremely LoF intolerant set of genes
